channel.title: Andy Barr
channel.description: Andy Barr Republican Candidate for Congress, Kentucky 6th District (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Beyond the rolling hills of the Bluegrass, within the depths of steep mountainsides, Kentuckians built a coal industry that powers America.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: Coal provides Kentuckians with some of the lowest electricity costs in America ­ enabling companies like Toyota to create 7,000 jobs in Georgetown, Kentucky.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: This year alone, 2,000 Kentucky miners lost their jobs because of Obama's "War on Coal." For every mining job lost, three additional jobs are threatened, including those at Toyota.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: Rarely in history has a single industry been so ruthlessly attacked with so little regard for the people it hurts.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: People like Chris Woods, a young coal miner who took me underground to show me his work. Chris considers himself lucky.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: He still has a job, driving an hour each way, for a 10-hour shift. His paycheck supports his wife, two kids and both sets of parents.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: Chris looked me in the eyes. I'll never forget his words: "Andy, I don't know much about politics, and frankly I don't care about politics. But if you can save my job, I'm for you."
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: Chris, I care about your job.
item.author: Andy Barr

item.title: Mitt Romney cares about your job. And together, we're going to fight to save your job!
item.author: Andy Barr
